meanings.definition: The line of people waiting to receive free or low-cost food.
meanings.sent1: The breadline at the food bank stretched around the block.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the breadline forms outside the soup kitchen.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I'd end up in a breadline, but times are tough.
meanings.sent4: The breadline snaked through the park like a hungry serpent.
meanings.sent5: The image of the breadline haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: The level of income below which a person or family is considered to be living in poverty.
meanings.sent1: Many families found themselves below the breadline after losing their jobs.
meanings.sent2: Living below the breadline means struggling to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his bank account was so low, it was practically at the breadline.
meanings.sent4: The gap between the rich and the poor widened, pushing more people below the breadline.
meanings.sent5: The reality of poverty hit him hard when he fell below the breadline.
